title: M.S., Program Evaluation and Data Analytics
B.A., Business (Sustainability)
description_2: New American University Scholastic Award Recipient

title: Environmental Preferrable Purchasing Intern
description_1: Researched vendors/products from the citywide procurement contract list for evaluation against the EPP Policy with contract values >$1M of spend.
description_2: Retrieved and stored product lists from internal/external stakeholders through electronic and in-person communication to initiate product level certification mapping.
description_3: Communicated with city vendors both electronically and in-person to understand the opportunities they offered in green procurement and to further investigate their environmental certifications.

title: Sustainability Analyst
description_1: Answered enterprise customer inquiries and Code of Conduct requests using internal resources to provide information that impacted customer purchasing decisions.
description_2: Designed an Access database for procurement team to store suppliers’ GHG emissions data reported to CDP representing >$37B in material spend and have it effectively analyzed in multiple ways (i.e. error checking, and emission trends).
description_3:
Supported sales teams by profiling our enterprise customers to find alignment in corporate social responsibility commitments to
be used during customer engagement.

title: Analyst, Technical Development
description_1: Store, process, and manage all supply chain sustainability data for TSC containing data from global retailers with >7.5 million data points.
description_2: Provide project support for Home and Personal care sector in the form of collaboration, stakeholder engagement, and content preparation.
description_3: Perform academic research to support member-based projects led by TSC such as project WearEver, and the Shared Vision for Green Chemistry.
